body_html: As I think we have mentioned elsewhere, there is a lot of code in python that we do hope to move into the core C implementation (shape inference, gradients, etc), so that the language bindings only have to be thin, idiomatic wrappers around the core functionality. But as you know, it is quite a bit of work to do this, and we already have some 100+ open issues to prioritize against too, so please be patient with us.
body_text: As I think we have mentioned elsewhere, there is a lot of code in python that we do hope to move into the core C implementation (shape inference, gradients, etc), so that the language bindings only have to be thin, idiomatic wrappers around the core functionality.  But as you know, it is quite a bit of work to do this, and we already have some 100+ open issues to prioritize against too, so please be patient with us.
body: As I think we have mentioned elsewhere, there is a lot of code in python that we do hope to move into the core C implementation (shape inference, gradients, etc), so that the language bindings only have to be thin, idiomatic wrappers around the core functionality.  But as you know, it is quite a bit of work to do this, and we already have some 100+ open issues to prioritize against too, so please be patient with us.
